page.title: 07Worksop College_Land + Staff
page.content: At present the College owns one hundred and thirty acres. This contains Sparken Hill Farm. The farm buildings are leased to a solicitor and the fields are farmed by a neighbouring farmer. The College now has thirty eight full time members of staff who have graduated from universities and are not necessarily locals. However the College does employ thirteen part time members of staff e.g. musicians who do live locally. When the students (some of whom come from as far away as Scotland and even Hong Kong) are in their first year they are given a 'cabin' which contains a desk and some shelves. In either their second or third year they move into larger studies. Most pupils sleep in dormitories which contain as many as forty beds.
